part2.question:
Describe a movie you watched recently that you felt disappointed about. You should say:
What it was
Why you decided to watch it
When you watched it
And explain why you felt disappointed about it.
part2.model_answer: To be honest, I recently sat through a sci-fi movie that was a huge A let-down [令人失望的事] for me personally last night. It was heavily Hype up [炒作] in ads but turned out to be completely Mediocre [平庸的]. Since the plot was Confusing [令人困惑的] and completely Predictable [老套的], it felt like a total Waste of time [浪费时间], although I had Anticipated [期待] it greatly for months. It was Overrated [被高估的] by critics and not Fulfilling [令人满足的] at all as a story. Watching it was surprisingly Demanding [费力的] because it was so boring and long, making me deeply regret buying the expensive ticket.

part2.question:

What the film was called
What you expected to see
What actually happened in the film

It was Overrated [被高估的] despite all the positive Hype up [炒作] online from enthusiastic fans and serious movie critics. Because it was Mediocre [平庸的] and the jokes were Predictable [老套的], it was A let-down [令人失望的事], even though I had Anticipated [期待] it to be funny. part3.question: Do you believe movie reviews?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Not necessarily, as critics often possess different Motivation [动机] than normal fans who just want fun and entertainment. Reason They dislike fun movies and prefer serious, artistic drama that wins awards but is boring to watch. Example Although they hate a Blockbuster [大片], regular fans usually love it for the action and effects.

part3.question: What are the different types of films in your country?
part3.model_answer: Opinion In my country, we boast many movie Genre [类型] options in our cinemas today for everyone to enjoy together. Reason Comedy and history are the most popular ones among families and young people in China right now. Example Since they have Influence [影响], people often copy the styles they see onscreen in their lives.

part3.question: Are historical films popular in your country? Why?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Unquestionably, this is largely due to the beautiful and realistic Cinematography [摄影] that captures visual details perfectly on the big screen. Reason It looks real and teaches us about the past effectively through visual storytelling and accurate costumes. Example Provided that it is good, we learn history while enjoying the story and characters.

part3.question: Do you think films with famous actors or actresses are more likely to become successful?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Without a doubt, a Star-studded cast [全明星阵容] helps sell millions of tickets globally every single year consistently. Reason Fans buy tickets just to see their favorite idols perform on the big screen in person. Example Unless it is terrible, it usually becomes a Box office hit [票房大卖] regardless of the actual script quality.

part3.question: Why are Japanese animated films so popular?
part3.model_answer: Opinion Typically, they tend to utilize less Automation [自动化] and computer effects than us in the West for animation films. Reason It feels more handmade, artistic, and emotional to watch for the audience who loves true art. Example While watching, you are often On the edge of one's seat [扣人心弦] with excitement and joy.

part3.question: Should directors pay a lot of money to famous actors?
part3.model_answer: Opinion I would argue against that; instead, we should invest on visual effects, not just famous stars' salaries which are huge and wasteful. Reason Quality stories matter more than famous faces in the end for lasting success and global fame. Example Although Censorship [审查] limits themes, good stories always win audience love and high ratings globally.
